page.title: 18PERSONAL RECOLLECTIONS 2
page.content: grafetti,more private transport, capital cinema which opened in 1935 and closed in 1974, opened again not as a cinema but as a supermarket and the growth of television after the war meant that less people went to the cinema and in the 1950's most people had televisions. JULIA.Did anyone famous or important live in the area? GRANNY.Yes Heather Harper a famous opera singer,Ronnie Carroll a pop singer of the 1950's and 1960's, Stephen Boyd a television star of the 1950's and 1960's, Bernard Mc Claverty a writer, James Galway a musician and Jimmie Cricket a comedian. JULIA.Can you remeber the grounds of Belfast Castle were like before the more modern houses were built? GRANNY.Yes there was gamekeepers in the grounds.
